Exercise

Which of the below describes a position vector?

answer.text: A vector which may be translated to any point in space provided their direction and length remain unchanged.

feedback.text: A position vector describes the position of a point relative to the origin, and so needs to be fixed to start at the origin.

answer.text: A vector which always starts at the origin of the coordinate system.
A vector whose length may change as long as its direction remains the same.

feedback.text: A vector is defined by both its magnitude and direction therefore by changing either of these we change the vector we are defining.

answer.text: A vector whose direction may change as long as its length stays the same.

feedback.text: A vector is defined by both its magnitude and direction therefore by changing either of these we change the vector we are defining.
